value.title: Quick guide to create new Dataflows in Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you confused by the four options available on the create Power BI dataflows welcome screen? In this video I will go through each of them and give you at the end the business user guide to it. value.title: R (and python) Guide to Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we will go all the capabilities that are available to you if you are a data scientist, when working with R and the same goes for python.  This is not an R or Python tutorial, just to be clear, but I will show you instead examples of where and how you can use R (and python) in your data

value.title: Real time dashboards in Power BI with Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Good evening, in today's video I will show you how to create a live stream, real time dashboard using an IoT device and Azure IOT hub, stream analytics and Power BI. value.title: Row Level Security in Power BI desktop - Power BI Tips & Tricks #27
value.excerpt: In this video we will see how to add Row Level security to your Power BI data.  Row Level security is used to restrict data access for given users. Filters restrict data at the row level. You can define filters within roles. What is Row Level Security: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-rls/

value.title: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression
value.excerpt: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression Vertipaq is the database and engine that runs on top of Power BI and PowerPivot.   When we import data in Power BI, the Vertipaq database will try with a series of algorithms, to compress the data as much as possible and the best way possible
